frame.name: State_continue
frame.definition:
<def-root>Despite some implication that a <fen>State</fen> would be interrupted, the <fen>Entity</fen> remains in the specified <fen>State</fen>. Note that <fen>State</fen> includes locative relations.
<ex><fex name="ent">Online security</fex> remains <fex name="sta">elusive</fex>.</ex> <ex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>State</fen> is found to still persist.
<ex>Financial recovery <t>remains</t> elusive <fex name="tim">in 2002</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the <fen>State</fen>.
<ex>Martial law <t>remains</t> in effect <fex name="pla">in Absurdistan</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state of affairs that explains why the <fen>State</fen> persists.
<ex>Simandle ruled that the contract <t>remains</t> in force <fex name="exp">because the GTMUA accepted $400,000 in connection fees from the trust</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time period over which the <fen>State</fen> continues to hold of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>Our commitment to high-quality, distinctively Canadian programming has <t>remained</t> constant <fex name="dur">for more than six decades</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: remain.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: continue to be in a specified state or location

lexUnit.name: stay.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: remain in the same place.

lexUnit.name: rest.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: remain in a particular location, especially after having been placed there.
